text: it was the case that for many summed up
the dysfunction of America's gun laws
and deaths of its racial divide Trayvon
Martin 17 african-american unarmed was
shot as he walked through the Florida
gated community in which he was staying
the acquittal of George Zimmerman the
head of the community Neighborhood Watch
who claimed self-defense caused uproar
we shut it down verdict sparked
nationwide protests and at the forefront
of those always Trayvon's parents Tracy
Martin and Sybrina Fulton who spoken out
about gun violence and criminal justice
reform
I met them both and began by asking
Tracy how quickly his son's death became
caught up in America's racial politics
it became a racial issue fairly quick
just looking at a lot of things on
social media before the even before the
arrest and and how people were had their
own perception and how people the
country started getting divided over
this incident and what was amazing was
the fact that through all the gifts we
had a dead 17 year old on the ground and
then you had you had supporters of the
killer of our son raising money for him
just just because it was a young
african-american man that had been shot
and killed and so unless sure it
definitely took a racial racial turn
that divided the country one of the
things that happened in the aftermath
was the emergence since the black lives
matter movement was not it came to
fruition after Trayvon's death and that
was attributed to african-americans as
being tired of being on the short end of
the stick how do you think you push it
forward now because you're campaigning
and we see that even when Obama with all
the things that happened from trail onto
Sandy Hook to all the other things
couldn't bring about a big change in the
gun culture of this country so how do
you convince people Sabrina that this is
not a hopeless struggle that there is
something worth fighting for here I mean
our kids are our future so so we have to
have some type of hope and we can't just
give up and say okay well that's the way
this country is and we're just going to
leave it just like it is you know we got
to do the best that we can and try to
make positive change
trizzie I mean you like the rest of us
watching the TV over the past year what
do you make of the Trump phenomenon the
election of this president watching
everything that that's been going on
over the past year it amazes me that you
can say or do just about anything you
want to do and then become the leader of
the free world and that just goes to
show the mindset of this country or the
division in this country and and and it
doesn't speak to reality because this is
this is isn't supposed to be a
dictatorship this is supposed to be
equal equal rights community is supposed
to be that we're all the same and I just
don't think with this administration so
follow the things that they're doing
they're proving that to be true I think
that um we did take a few steps back I
think even though we came a long way as
far as far as race and guns and and
education and everything I think right
now we have taken a few steps back
